intro: Jacquemontia mollissima, commonly known as the silky false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features soft, hairy leaves that give it a velvety texture, and its flowers are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Jacquemontia mollissima is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinators.
